meanings.definition: The act of preempting or the state of being preempted.
meanings.sent1: The preemptions of the limited edition sneakers caused a rush at the store.
meanings.sent2: She used her preemptions to secure the last available ticket to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The preemptions of the best seats at the cinema led to a comical chase scene.
meanings.sent4: His preemptions in the auction were like a strategic chess move.
meanings.sent5: The preemptions of the prime parking spots were fiercely contested.
